channel.description: Recent content in Labs for APMA E2000 on MVC Labs

item.title: Lab 3 - Circles and Curvature
item.description: You may work in groups of up to 3 students. Goals In this activity, you will: Parametrize a circle embedded in $\R^3$. Create curves via different parametrizations. Practice computing curvature. Synthesize the above to plot an osculating circle “by hand.” Circles We know that we can parametrize the unit circle in $\R^2$ via $\langle \cos t, \sin t \rangle$ and adjust the radius and center via dialation and translation: $$\mathbf r(t) = \langle R\cos(t) + h, R\sin(t) + k \rangle$$ But what about embedding a circle in $\R^3$?

item.title: Lab 0 - Vectors & Combinations
item.description: A first lab playing with points and vectors.
